709582f-a.text:

713657f-b.title: Manhattan: 53rd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713657f-b.text:
West 53rd Street, east from a point east of Sixth Ave. and showing a clearance (incorporating Nos. 2 to 22) that adjoins the S.W. corner of yifth ave. This may have been necessitated by subway construction which is progressing in the westerly portion of this block. On the opposite side, at the N.W. corner of Fifth Ave. is St. Thomas P.E. Church.. This set consiets of three views, No. 2 and 3 emphasising the aforementioned clearance. The latter is in a southwesterly direction to show the R.K.O. Building of Rockefeller Center across the roofs of buildings on the north
side of Weat 52nd Street.
November 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

713655f-a.title: Manhattan: 53rd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713655f-a.text:
West 53rd Street, east from Sixth Avenue, showing at the left and right respectively, buildinga at the N.E. and S.E. corners. The buildings to the rear of the latter are being removed to permit tunnelling for the eastward curve of the Sixth Avenue line of the Municipal Subway. View 2 is photographed across the Avenue, from the west side of same. Note the portion of the R. K. O. Bldg.
in Rockefeller City at the upper right.
April 20, 1939
August 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr

713655f-b.text:
West 53rd Street, east from Sixth Avenue, showing at the left and right respectively, buildinga at the N.E. and S.E. corners. The buildings to the rear of the latter are being removed to permit tunnelling for the eastward curve of the Sixth Avenue line of the Municipal Subway. View 2 is photographed across the Avenue, from the west side of same. Note the portion of the R. K. O. Bldg.

April 20, 1939
August 3, 1940

713656f-b.title: Manhattan: 53rd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713656f-b.text:
W:est 53rd Street, west from Sixth Avenue, showing this thoroughfare re-opened to view. The old Sixth Avenue "E;" structure that formerly obliterated the view has
been removed.
March 11, 1939
April 20, 1939
P. L. Sperr

713654f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 53rd Street (West)
713654f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, south from W. 53rd Street, showing the locale partially freed of the obsolete "El' structure. Previously it turned westward on 53rd Street to join the 9th Avenue line at that Avenue. View 2 shows the street on its right. The third building site from the corner has already been cleared. Adjoinlng on the south are several tenements that are soon to come down. The latter will provide a site for a modern 6-story aparthment house. Data for same is to he found in the New York Sun of March 19, 1939, the New York Times of January 7, 1940 and the
Herald Tribune of January 21, 1940.
March 4, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

713658f-a.title: Manhattan: 53rd Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713658f-a.text:
West 53rd Street, south side, west from (No. 48, left) a point slightly east of Sixth Ave. and across same, showing a clearance (former Nos. 56 to 62 inclusive) necessitated by subway construction. In the westerly end of this block, the,gow being constructed Sixth Ave. subway, will make a bend and veer eastod. Note the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line
on the Avenue.
November 22, 1937.
L. Sperr.

713659f-a.title: Manhattan: 53rd Street (West) - 6th Avenue

143-101 West 53rd Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W.
corner of Sixth Ave.

709572f-c.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 53nd Street (West)
709572f-c.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, at W. 53rd Street as viewed northwestward from 52nd Street. Formerly this corner was darkened by the old 6th Aenue "El" which made a 908bend to run west on 53rd Street. The vacant lot at the left has recently been cleared by the demolition of a 4-story frame building with a brick front. The adjoining 5-story tenement is being removed in Views 2 and 3.
This bears No. 1309 (old No. 927) Sixth Avenue.
At the left margin, in the later view, is the 6-story dwelling that is to be razed and its site improved by a modern apartment structure. This is to be fhe first major development on the avenue. For details and the architects' drawing--see New York Times of January 7, 1940 and the Herald Tribune of January 21, 1940 and the
New York Sun of March 19, 1938.
View 1: March 4, 1939
View 2: April 20, 1939
View 3: April 20, 1939
P. L. Sperr

709573f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 53rd Street (West)
709573f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Aveue, at the S.N. corn3r of . 53rd Street, showino the 5iE th Avere "E)" turning westMard Oh 53rd Street. The last train on this line 2as run at 1O:3O P.N. SudaV, December 4, 1938; the citv taking ownership as of December S,
Sreparatorv to the deLiolition of same.
March 19, 1938.
P.L. Snerr.
(2)
Another view of the same location photographed in a southwesterly direction from the N.E. corner of this point showing the last train on its northward trip rounding the bend. Across same appear buildings at the N.W. corner of 52nd Street which are to be demolished and their site improved with a modern apartment house. This is the first extensive improvement on this thoroughfare resulting from
the "El" demolition.
March 1939.
Vhm. Herries.
